intro: Tanaecium lilacinum, commonly known as the lilac moonflower, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking, large, white to lilac-colored flowers that open at night. The plant belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae) and is known for its fragrant, tubular blooms. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and have a velvety texture. Tanaecium lilacinum is often cultivated for its ornamental value and nocturnal beauty.
